byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: S on Eur war, luncheon honoring Canada's 1st Div
snippet: LONDON, Jan. 31--Anthony Eden, Dominions Secretary, today cited Canada's entry on the European battlefield and Nazi "cold-blooded torture" as two historic acts that would decide the war....

headline.main: EDEN FLAYS NAZI 'BEAST'; Praises Commonwealth Unity at Luncheon for Canadians

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 31--Anthony Eden, Dominions Secretary, today cited Canada's entry on the European battlefield and Nazi "cold-blooded torture" as two historic acts that would decide the war.
